title: Exploring the distribution formats of albums released between 2000-2020
description: This data story explores the resources available on Wikidata – the centralised, linked data repository for all Wikimedia projects – to overview the topic at hand from a statistical point of view, providing insight into the ever shifting landscape of the music industry.

dynamic_elements.text:
Driven by technological advancement and changing consumer preferences, the music industry has witnessed, over the past two decades, significant transformations in relation to the way music is accessed and consumed. This data story delves into the distribution formats of albums released between 2000-2020, focusing on vinyls/LPs, CDs, and streaming platforms.

﻿

dynamic_elements.chart_title: Albums released on CD format between 2000-2020

dynamic_elements.text:
The advent of digital technology and streaming platforms has revolutionised the way music is distributed, leading to the decline of physical formats – including but not limited to compact discs (CDs). Of late, however, a surprising trend has emerged, driven by nostalgia: vinyl revival.

﻿

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?item) AS ?count)
WHERE {
     ?item ?a wd:Q482994;
           wdt:P577 ?date.
  {?item wdt:P437 wd:Q178588} # vinyl record
  UNION
  {?item wdt:P437 wd:Q841983} # LP record


  BIND(YEAR(?date) AS ?label) FILTER(YEAR(?date) <= 2020 && YEAR(?date) > 1999)
}

GROUP BY ?label ?count
ORDER BY ?label
